title: Saad Awad replaces injured Sabah Homasi at Bellator 232, meets Paul Daley on 5 days' notice
text:
Bellator 232 has another last-minute change to its main card.

On Monday, promotion president Scott Coker announced on Twitter that Sabah Homasi has been injured and forced to withdraw from his welterweight bout with Paul Daley on Saturday. In Homasi’s place, Saad Awad will fight Daley at a 175-pound catchweight.

Bellator 232 takes place Saturday as part of a weekend doubleheader at Mohegan Sun Arena in Uncasville, Conn., with a main card that streams on DAZN following prelims on MMA Junkie.

Awad (23-12 MMA, 11-8 BMMA) will make a quick turnaround after losing by submission to Goiti Yamauchi earlier this month at Bellator 229. It was Awad’s third straight defeat.

Daley (41-17-2 MMA, 7-4 BMMA) enters the bout coming off a victory over Erick Silva at Bellator 223 in June.

Sabah Homasi has been forced to withdraw from his fight this Saturday due to injury. Paul "@Semtex_170" Daley now faces @SAADMMA Awad in 175-lb. contract weight bout. pic.twitter.com/OaXhTIuXYy — Scott Coker (@ScottCoker) October 21, 2019

The latest Bellator 232 lineup now includes:

MAIN CARD (DAZN, 10 p.m. ET)

Rory MacDonald vs. Douglas Lima

Paul Daley vs. Saad Awad

Isaiah Chapman vs. Patrick Mix

Javy Ayala vs. Vitaly Minakov

Luis Muro vs. Nick Newell

Cris Lencioni vs. Robin van Roosmalen

PRELIMINARY CARD (MMA Junkie, 6:45 p.m. ET)
description: Bellator 232 has another last-minute change to its main card.
